title: Digital Water Forecast
text:
Atos IT Challenge 2020 — 2nd Place (First Mexican team in the competition’s history)
Digital Water is a cooperative-AI prototype built to help city utilities forecast water demand and available capacity. Using official data from Agua y Drenaje de Monterrey (SADM), we modeled daily demand and dam capacity to surface early warning signals for shortages.

title: Digital Water Forecast
text:
Context
This project focused on Monterrey, Mexico, my hometown. At the time, we did not realize the city was on the verge of a major water crisis that unfolded two years later. The work highlighted how proactive forecasting can shift utilities from reactive operations to preventative planning.

title: Digital Water Forecast
text:
Approach
We built an end-to-end Python workflow that: 1. Cleaned and aligned multi-source time-series data (consumption + dam capacity). 2. Trained two LSTM models to forecast daily demand and daily capacity. 3. Produced outputs that estimated “days-to-threshold” for safe levels. 4. Presented results via a web dashboard (hosted on Heroku at the time).
